page.title: 06History: Cobham Hall Estate
page.content: By 1660, the village of Shorne was taking its present shape, with Shorne Ridgeway and other outlying areas. During the 17th and 18th Centuries farming was done on an increasingly large scale in the area. In the 1780s, Lord Darnley expanded Cobham Hall estate, including farms and woodland. By the 1830s, the Darnleys were the big landowners of the area. In the second half of the 19th Century Lord Darnley let off farms, coppiced otherwise rough woodland and landscaped the parks around Cobham Hall. A restoration of these parks is shortly to be undertaken. In the 20th Century death duties and money worries led to the selling off of Darnley properties. A big sale of land in 1925 and another after WW2 ended the Darnley influence. The remaining woodland is up for sale.
